meanings.definition: To partially deify or make divine.
meanings.sent1: The ancient legend tells of a hero who could semideify himself in times of great need.
meanings.sent2: The artist's masterpiece seemed to semideify the beauty of nature.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully pretended to semideify their favorite superhero during recess.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had the power to semideify even the simplest of words.
meanings.sent5: The magical potion had the ability to semideify ordinary objects into extraordinary ones.

meanings.definition: To elevate or exalt to a semi-divine status.
meanings.sent1: The king's noble deeds helped semideify him in the eyes of his people.
meanings.sent2: The ancient myths often semideify heroes who accomplished great feats.
meanings.sent3: The chef's delicious dish seemed to semideify him among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The sunset's beauty semideified the evening sky.
meanings.sent5: The music had a magical quality that semideified the atmosphere of the room.
